meta.scoring_methodology: 1-5 scale per criterion, averaged for overall score. Target: ≥4.0 per page, ≥4.5 site-wide.

author_expertise.5: Author credentials, bio, photo, expertise statement visible above fold. External verification (LinkedIn, past work).
author_expertise.4: Author credentials and bio visible. Expertise clear from byline.
author_expertise.3: Author name present with minimal credentials.
author_expertise.1: No author attribution or generic 'Editorial Desk'.

experience_evidence.5: Clear first-hand testing/reporting ('We tested...', '20+ interviews', specific dates, methodology disclosed).
experience_evidence.4: Some experience evidence (testing mentioned, but minimal methodology).
experience_evidence.3: Implied experience (credible analysis, but no explicit testing claims).
experience_evidence.2: Generic research summary, no unique insights.
experience_evidence.1: Appears to be content aggregation or AI-generated without verification.

external_sources.5: 5+ authoritative external sources (gov, edu, org, primary docs). All links work.
external_sources.3: 1-2 authoritative sources or several secondary sources.
external_sources.1: No external sources or all links are placeholders (#).

schema_valid.5: Complete NewsArticle/Review/TechArticle schema with author Person, publisher, dates, citations.
schema_valid.4: Basic NewsArticle schema with author and publisher.
schema_valid.2: Schema present but incomplete or invalid.

trust_design.5: Author photo, byline, publish/update dates, editorial policy link, contact info all above fold. Professional design.
trust_design.4: Author byline, dates, contact link visible. Good design.
trust_design.3: Basic trust signals present (dates, author) but not prominent.
trust_design.1: No visible trust signals (no dates, no author, no contact info).
